answers.answer: If you have any kind of vaginal infection, particularly yeast, sex can make you itch even more.  Look up "vaginal infections" on Google and see if maybe you have a bacterial or yeast infection.
tnx for the rply...and what would be the signs if maybe i have a yeast infection?and how to prevent this?or what would be the medicine i should take..that to much expensive..tnx again

I've had the same problem. In my case the cause is very innocent: the balance of the bacteria present in the vagina is disturbed (this in turn could have all kinds of innocent causes: hormones, diabetes, the pil...). This causes the vagina to itch and sometimes even smell bad. This problem, 'a disturbed balance', is a problem many women have!! But not everyone experiences the downsides (itch, smell).My family doctors all said nothing can be done about this imbalance. My mom has had it for years and years, until she stopped taking the pil! But if it really itches, you should go see a doctor. She/he will give you some vaginal pills (after a simple test). This helps get rid of the itch!!Good luck.
PS: such a test will also help determine if you might have a yeast or bacterial infection. Rest assured, those infections are not explicitly caused by sex!

thanks...any way i feel itch every time the sexual intercourse happen with me and my bf...maybe it takes for two weeks...and it doesn't smell bad also..the problem is the itchiness of my vagina?...so much better to check up..but afraid co'z i didnt check up since

itch alone is common with bacteria or yeast infections, or disturbed balances. You should go see a doctor, because your boyfriend could be infected too (which isn't bad). He could keep infecting you back and that way you'll never get rid of it...
